intro: Pedicularis vagans, commonly known as the wandering beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Pedicularis vagans is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique floral display.
